title: Keto Diet
description: The Keto diet is a low-carb, high-fat diet that aims to put the body into a state of ketosis, where it burns fat for fuel instead of carbohydrates. It involves significantly reducing carbohydrate intake and increasing fat consumption.

title: Mediterranean Diet
description: The Mediterranean diet emphasizes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, nuts, and seeds, along with healthy fats from olive oil and fish.

title: Paleo Diet
description: The Paleo diet focuses on consuming foods that would have been available to our ancestors, including meat, fish, fruits, vegetables, nuts, and seeds.

title: Vegan Diet
description: The Vegan diet excludes all animal products, focusing on plant-based foods including fruits, vegetables, grains, nuts, and seeds.

title: Mediterranean Dash Diet
description: The Mediterranean Dash Diet combines elements of the Mediterranean diet with the principles of the DASH (Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension) diet to manage blood pressure.

title: Whole30 Diet
description: The Whole30 diet is a 30-day program focusing on eating whole, unprocessed foods and eliminating sugar, alcohol, grains, legumes, and dairy.

title: DASH Diet
description: The DASH diet (Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension) focuses on reducing blood pressure through a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and low-fat dairy while limiting sodium, saturated fats, and cholesterol.

title: Flexitarian Diet
description: The Flexitarian diet is a flexible vegetarian diet that emphasizes plant-based foods but allows for occasional meat and fish consumption. It focuses on improving overall health and reducing the environmental impact of meat consumption.

title: Raw Food Diet
description: The Raw Food diet consists of unprocessed, uncooked, and often organic foods, including fruits, vegetables, nuts, seeds, and sprouted grains. It is believed to help with detoxification and improve overall health.
whoShouldAvoid: People needing a higher calorie intake

title: Whole Foods Plant-Based Diet
description: The Whole Foods Plant-Based diet focuses on consuming whole, unprocessed plant foods. It excludes animal products, processed foods, and refined sugars, aiming to improve health and prevent chronic diseases.

title: Anti-Inflammatory Diet
description: The Anti-Inflammatory diet focuses on reducing inflammation in the body by consuming foods with anti-inflammatory properties and avoiding those that may trigger inflammation. It aims to improve overall health and manage chronic conditions.

title: Atkins Diet
description: The Atkins Diet is a low-carb diet that emphasizes protein and fat consumption while reducing carbohydrate intake. It is designed to help with weight loss and improve overall health.

title: South Beach Diet
description: The South Beach Diet is a low-carb diet that emphasizes lean proteins, healthy fats, and high-fiber carbohydrates. It aims to promote weight loss and heart health.
whoShouldAvoid: People with specific carbohydrate metabolism issues

title: Zone Diet
description: The Zone Diet focuses on balancing macronutrients (proteins, carbohydrates, and fats) in a 40:30:30 ratio to stabilize blood sugar levels and promote weight loss.

title: Alkaline Diet
description: The Alkaline Diet focuses on consuming foods that are believed to help maintain the body's pH balance by emphasizing alkaline-forming foods and reducing acid-forming foods.

title: FODMAP Diet
description: The FODMAP Diet is designed to help manage symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and other digestive disorders by reducing the intake of fermentable carbohydrates known as FODMAPs.
whoShouldAvoid: People with IBS or similar digestive issues
